page.title: 20TRADITIONAL BUILDINGS
page.content: Most of the buildings in the area which are over one hundred years old are made from local building materials. Clay which was dug around most of the villages was made into soft red bricks and roof tiles.The roof tiles are called Pantiles. A lot of old buildings are thatched with local reed gathered from the edges of the broads.The thatch lasts about 80 years.Originally it was a cheap material to use,now to thatch a typical small cottage costs about Â£3,000. Some old buildings are made from clay lump.This is a mixture of clay, straw and sometimes animal dung which is formed into blocks and left to dry in the sun.When built into a wall these blocks are covered on the outside with tar to make them waterproof.
